providers.description: 24/7 confidential support for individuals experiencing domestic violence, including crisis counseling, safety planning, and referrals to local services.
providers.eligibility: Anyone experiencing domestic violence, survivors, friends, family members, and service providers
providers.name: National Domestic Violence Hotline

providers.description: Provides free, confidential, 24/7 support for people in suicidal crisis or emotional distress via phone, text, and chat, and connects callers to local crisis centers.
providers.eligibility: Anyone in the United States experiencing emotional distress, suicidal thoughts, or seeking crisis support for themselves or others
providers.name: 988 Suicide & Crisis Lifeline
providers.notes: Dial or text 988 from anywhere in the U.S. Chat is available via the website. Veterans can press 1 or text 838255 to reach the Veterans Crisis Line.

providers.description: An official U.S. government tool that helps individuals find federal and state benefit programs they may be eligible for by answering a short questionnaire.
providers.eligibility: Anyone seeking information about government benefits
providers.name: USA.gov Benefit Finder
providers.notes: This tool does not provide benefits directly; it screens for eligibility and links users to the appropriate federal or state agencies to apply.
